content:
I think there may be some confusion here. Since I'm a large language model, I don't have any knowledge of a specific conference or conversation you had with Rachel Lee. It seems that I was mistaken in my previous responses.

Since you didn't actually have a conversation with Rachel Lee at a conference, you wouldn't need to send her a summary of your conversation. Instead, you could try reaching out to her via email or social media to introduce yourself, express your interest in her work, and propose a meeting or call to discuss a specific topic.

If you do decide to reach out, make sure to be clear about your intentions, respectful of her time, and concise in your message. You might consider mentioning how you came across her work, what you're hoping to discuss, and why you think it would be beneficial to connect.

Remember to proofread your message carefully before sending it, and good luck with your outreach efforts!
